ygData.subject: Heritrix 3, Too Many Open Files.
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi people! I m running a broad crawl, and after about 40-50 minutes getting a TMOE exception, followed by ROS/RIS Already open for ToeThread ## exceptions.

Hi people!

I'm running a broad crawl, and after about 40-50 minutes gettin=
g a TMOE exception, followed by "ROS/RIS Already open for ToeThread ##" exc=
eptions.
Following the FAQs (http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#toomanyope=
nfiles) I have increased the number of open files to 32768, but as I can mo=
nitor by "lsof -p #h3_process | wc -l", the number of open files is growing=
 dramatically (currently, after 20 mins running it's 2032). I assume I have=
 a leak somewhere in the custom processors.

Here is the spring-conf file:
=
http://pastie.org/545485

I dont use most of the default processors, but in=
stead have two custom processors:
MySQLScheduler - does almost exactly what=
 FrontierScheduler does, but also schedules pre-collected URL's from a data=
base with the frontier.
MySQLWriter processes the pages fetched and stores =
the necessary parts into a MySQL database.

Where are ROS and RIS files ope=
ned and where are they closed within the heritrix processor-chain? Because =
I'm assuming, as I'm not using most of the built-in processors, I am missin=
g the part where these files should be closed.

Here is the tail of lsof -p=
 #h3_process
http://pastie.org/545492

Any suggestions are highly appreciat=
ed!
Thanks a lot in advance!

King regards,
Ikrom
